de.smits_net.games.framework.sprite

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.smits_net.games.framework.sprite.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimatedSprite

    public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Class representing a sprite, i.e. an moveable object in the game.
    Author:
    Thomas Smits

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Sprite.BoundaryPolicy
      How to handle sprites that reach the boundaries of the board.

      the game board.

      what happens when the sprite hits the boundaries.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(Board board,
              java.awt.Point position,
              Sprite.BoundaryPolicy policy,
              ImagePack image)
        Creates a new sprite.
        Parameters:
        board - the board the sprite is displayed on
        position - position of the upper left corner of the sprite
        policy - the policy when the sprite reaches the boundaries of the board
        image - the images

    • Method Detail

      • absoluteBorder

        protected java.awt.Polygon absoluteBorder()
        Calculate the border in relation to the current position. This is required to detect intersections between sprites.
        Returns:
        the border's absolute position

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw the sprite using the given graphics context. This method does not use an ImageObserver and just sets it to null.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics context

                 java.awt.image.ImageObserver observer)
        Draw the sprite.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics context
        observer - image observer

      • move

        public void move(Velocity deltaV)
        Moves the sprite.
        Parameters:
        deltaV - delta velocity to add to the current velocity of the sprite

      • setActive

        public final void setActive(boolean active)
        Sets activity state of the sprite, i.e. if the sprite should take part in collision detection. This method does not turn off the collision detected of the intersects methods but is just there to provide a flag for the user of the sprite to tag it as active/inactive.
        Parameters:
        active - state to be set

      • setBorder

        public final void setBorder(java.awt.Polygon border)
        Sets the border of the sprite (for collision detection).
        Parameters:
        border - the border to set

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Overwrite the bounds automatically determined from the board.
        Parameters:
        bounds - the new bounds

      • setVelocity

        public final void setVelocity(Velocity velocity)
        Set the velocity of the sprite.
        Parameters:
        velocity - velocity

      • setVisible

        public final void setVisible(java.lang.Boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility.
        Parameters:
        visible - visibility state

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the movement of the sprite.
